newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo aluminium futures finish higher aided by dlr.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo aluminium futures finish higher aided by dlr.

text.p: Tokyo yen-based aluminium futures finished higher in thin trade on Wednesday as the dollar's earlier recovery triggered some sporadic buying, traders said.
"It was very quiet," said one trader. "People are disappointed. The dollar dropped quickly. On the LME, aluminium's upperside proved heavy."
Traders said market participants had not recovered from a shock on Tuesday when they saw the dollar plunging to below 112 yen from above 115 yen in Tokyo trade.
The dollar was around 113.60 in late trade, compared to its New York close of 112.58/68 yen.

Benchmark April 1998 added one yen to 191.4 yen per kg after opening at its day's low of 190.4 yen. Other contracts were up one yen to two yen. Estimated volume was 3,331 lots, down from 4,169 lots on Tuesday.
